channel.title: Client Stuff
channel.description: How do I change my loading bar color?

item.title: Client Stuff
item.dc:creator: @_CopyRight CopyRight
item.description:
@_CopyRight wrote:

Changing text and colours in the loading bar.
This is easilly done. Just search for anything that the loading bar says when it is loading such as “Requesting interfaces”. You will see the string “Requesting interfaces.” Just replace that with what ever you would like to be displayed.

You should also see a hex code which looks something like 0xffffff, these are standard html text colours, replace them with any hex value you like but leave the 0x bit in. Html hex codes can be found at: http://html-color-codes.com/

Rebranding the client and making it your own.
This is very easy. Simply locate every “runescape” and replace it with your server name. for me it would be “Shitscape”. This is simple but effective

Adding your own background -> Clicky = http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,14828.0.html

Loading slightly more uptodate cache files: Clicky = http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,129.0.html

[size=3pt]Look in the tut, I got this from it.[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: Client Stuff
item.dc:creator: @Liam123 Liam123
item.description:
@Liam123 wrote:

Search for;

Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method337(c / 2 - 152, 304, 34, 0x8b0000, j, true);

after 0x change it to the html color code of ur choice.

        Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method337(c / 2 - 152, 304, 34, 0x8b0000, j, true); // Dis 1 iz outline
        Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method337(c / 2 - 151, 302, 32, 0, j + 1, true);
        Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method336(30, j + 2, c / 2 - 150, 0x8b0000, i * 3, 0); // Dis 1 iz loading bar
        Class30_Sub2_Sub1.method336(30, j + 2, (c / 2 - 150) + i * 3, 0, 300 - i * 3, 0);
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method381(0xFFFFFF, s, 23693, (c1 / 2 + 5) - byte1, c / 2); // Dis 1 iz da text
